#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Enjoy a Good Book
#Text=One of life 's greatest activities is reading .
#Text=Not only can you learn a lot by reading , books can take you to far away places that you have never dreamed of .
#Text=On top of that , enjoying a book can be a pleasurable and memorable experience .
#Text=There are millions of books out there , and no two are exactly alike !
#Text=Pick up a book and read !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Learn to read .
#Text=Hopefully , if you are reading this , you have grasped this step already .
#Text=If you already know how to read , learn to read better .
#Text=This can be accomplished by reading more .
#Text=You can never be too good at reading .
#Text=Try an audiobook .
#Text=Discover a genre you like .
#Text=Fiction and nonfiction have several genres , and it wo n't be hard to find something you like .
#Text=Even magazines and newspapers are great reading material !
#Text=If you want , find several genres you like .
#Text=Reading will be more enjoyable if you are reading diverse things .
#Text=Consider game books .
#Text=Get a book .
#Text=This can be accomplished by buying one , borrowing one from a friend , or visiting your local lending library .
#Text=Try not to over look this step .
#Text=Reading 's hard to do if you do n't have a book .
#Text=Find some time .
#Text=You might have the excuse that you do n't have time to read .
#Text=Put aside some time and devote it just to that : reading .
#Text=Thirty minutes is a good length ; however , even twenty , fifteen , or ten minute sessions can be enough .
#Text=Get comfortable .
#Text=Sitting in a comfortable seat can help you enjoy your book a lot more .
#Text=Or even just laying back and relaxing .
#Text=On top of that , being in a comfortable setting will make you want to stay and read .
#Text=But do n't limit your place to chairs .
#Text=You can sit on a couch , a bed , or even the floor if you prefer !
#Text=Make sure your setting is nice and quiet too .
#Text=Find a friend
#Text=.
#Text=Reading can be more enjoyable when you do it with a friend .
#Text=Try to read the same book .
#Text=Although if you read different books then keep each other informed on how good the book is .
#Text=This will build up and keep you anticipated to read it too .
#Text=The best part is reading what each of you just read .
#Text=That way , you can discuss your book in a friendly manner .
#Text=Also , a friend can encourage you to read .
#Text=Do n't hesitate to encourage your friend also .
#Text=Read .
#Text=Just read ! You 'll find that novel completed in no time at all !
#Text=Tips
#Text=You also may want a snack or something to drink .
#Text=Just do n't spill on your reading materials !
#Text=Use a bookmark .
#Text=It is so frustrating to come back and realize that you already read that part of the book .
#Text=You may also skip over a few chapters and not know what 's going on .
#Text=Use one that is fun and colorful so you wo n't mind having it with you .
#Text=Get a notebook and make notes .
#Text=If you are anxious to get to the ending , do n't force the words into your head .
#Text=Relax a little and take a break when you need one .
#Text=This way you will really enjoy what you 're reading .

#Text=If it was a very long book or one you did n't think you would like to begin with ( but you ended up liking it ) reward yourself by getting the movie , or getting some ice cream or just having a good time !
#Text=If you get into hard spots to get past , then reread it , slowly .
#Text=It may help to read it aloud .
#Text=If it is still tough , then consider getting the audio-book .
#Text=They are very good , and the fun voices make them enjoyable .
#Text=You should not be tired when reading !
#Text=This will only tempt you you to fall asleep or watch TV .
#Text=If you want , you can listen to a CD or your MP3/iPod while reading .
#Text=If you especially enjoy a book you can replay the CD when you read it again or read another book .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=you may just enjoy reading yet .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=books
